column4: All I want to say to the spouses of the people on this side of the debate, "Don't confide in your spouse and tell them that you killed somebody; they'll turn you in! And if they find out on their own, take them out before they turn you in!" ;)

column4: No way, Marriage (in my eyes) is supposed to be a Bond/Partnership. Not that I'm calling anyone who would turn his or her spouse in to police A "Snitch" or a rat, but If my wife where to kill someone,' I wouldnt hesitate to flex the 5th amendment! Murder Is a heavy offense But Remember, when you say "I DO", you're basically inviting the person You're marrying into the Family. So ask yourself... would YOU turn in FAMILY?? If so, join the police force. If not, kudos! (I would still divorce the crazy chick though!)

column4: No way, Marriage (in my eyes) is supposed to be a Bond/Partnership. Not that I'm calling anyone who would turn his or her spouse in to police A "Snitch" or a rat, but If my wife where to kill someone,' I wouldnt hesitate to flex the 5th amendment! Murder Is a heavy offense But Remember, when you say "I DO", you're basically inviting the person You're marrying into the Family. So ask yourself... would YOU turn in FAMILY?? If so, join the police force. If not, kudos! (I would still divorce the crazy chick though!)

column5: No way, Marriage (in my eyes) is supposed to be a Bond/Partnership. Not that I'm calling anyone who would turn his or her spouse in to police A "Snitch" or a rat, but If my wife where to kill someone,' I wouldnt hesitate to flex the 5th amendment! Murder Is a heavy offense But Remember, when you say "I DO", you're basically inviting the person You're marrying into the Family. So ask yourself... would YOU turn in FAMILY?? column4: No way, Marriage (in my eyes) is supposed to be a Bond/Partnership. Not that I'm calling anyone who would turn his or her spouse in to police A "Snitch" or a rat, but If my wife where to kill someone,' I wouldnt hesitate to flex the 5th amendment! Murder Is a heavy offense But Remember, when you say "I DO", you're basically inviting the person You're marrying into the Family. So ask yourself... would YOU turn in FAMILY?? If so, join the police force. If not, kudos! (I would still divorce the crazy chick though!)

column4: Love is much greater then any mistake. I know things happen but my wife will be able to confide in me no matter what goes wrong. I made a commitment to stay whit her through rough times and I will. Murder is a unforgivable mistake but love is not.

column4: If my husband where to commit a murder I would most likely not turn him in. He's my husband and I'm going to be there for him for better or for worst. column5: No way, Marriage (in my eyes) is supposed to be a Bond/Partnership. Not that I'm calling anyone who would turn his or her spouse in to police A "Snitch" or a rat, but If my wife where to kill someone,' I wouldnt hesitate to flex the 5th amendment! Murder Is a heavy offense But Remember, when you say "I DO", you're basically inviting the person You're marrying into the Family. So ask yourself... would YOU turn in FAMILY?? If so, join the police force. If not, kudos! (I would still divorce the crazy chick though!)

Murder Is a heavy offense But Remember, when you say "I DO", you're basically inviting the person You're marrying into the Family. So ask yourself... would YOU turn in FAMILY?? column5: No way, Marriage (in my eyes) is supposed to be a Bond/Partnership. Not that I'm calling anyone who would turn his or her spouse in to police A "Snitch" or a rat, but If my wife where to kill someone,' I wouldnt hesitate to flex the 5th amendment! Murder Is a heavy offense But Remember, when you say "I DO", you're basically inviting the person You're marrying into the Family. So ask yourself... would YOU turn in FAMILY?? If so, join the police force. If not, kudos! (I would still divorce the crazy chick though!)

column4: If my husband had committed a murder I think I would not turn him in because my feelings would be stronger that the fear of having a bad husband, I am not sure of my exact answer but I am sure that I couldn't look at him everyday and act like nothing happened, I believe that feeling are stronger than anything and I would not like the fact that he would probably be sentenced to death or spend the rest of his life in prison.

column4: No way, Marriage (in my eyes) is supposed to be a Bond/Partnership. Not that I'm calling anyone who would turn his or her spouse in to police A "Snitch" or a rat, but If my wife where to kill someone,' I wouldnt hesitate to flex the 5th amendment! Murder Is a heavy offense But Remember, when you say "I DO", you're basically inviting the person You're marrying into the Family. So ask yourself... would YOU turn in FAMILY?? If so, join the police force. If not, kudos! (I would still divorce the crazy chick though!)

column4: No way, Marriage (in my eyes) is supposed to be a Bond/Partnership. Not that I'm calling anyone who would turn his or her spouse in to police A "Snitch" or a rat, but If my wife where to kill someone,' I wouldnt hesitate to flex the 5th amendment! Murder Is a heavy offense But Remember, when you say "I DO", you're basically inviting the person You're marrying into the Family. So ask yourself... would YOU turn in FAMILY?? If so, join the police force. If not, kudos! (I would still divorce the crazy chick though!)

column4: No way, Marriage (in my eyes) is supposed to be a Bond/Partnership. Not that I'm calling anyone who would turn his or her spouse in to police A "Snitch" or a rat, but If my wife where to kill someone,' I wouldnt hesitate to flex the 5th amendment! Murder Is a heavy offense But Remember, when you say "I DO", you're basically inviting the person You're marrying into the Family. So ask yourself... would YOU turn in FAMILY?? If so, join the police force. If not, kudos! (I would still divorce the crazy chick though!)

Not that I'm calling anyone who would turn his or her spouse in to police A "Snitch" or a rat, but If my wife where to kill someone,' I wouldnt hesitate to flex the 5th amendment! Murder Is a heavy offense But Remember, when you say "I DO", you're basically inviting the person You're marrying into the Family. So ask yourself... would YOU turn in FAMILY?? If so, join the police force. If not, kudos! (I would still divorce the crazy chick though!)

column5: No way, Marriage (in my eyes) is supposed to be a Bond/Partnership. Not that I'm calling anyone who would turn his or her spouse in to police A "Snitch" or a rat, but If my wife where to kill someone,' I wouldnt hesitate to flex the 5th amendment! Murder Is a heavy offense But Remember, when you say "I DO", you're basically inviting the person You're marrying into the Family. So ask yourself... would YOU turn in FAMILY?? If so, join the police force. If not, kudos! (I would still divorce the crazy chick though!)

column5: No way, Marriage (in my eyes) is supposed to be a Bond/Partnership. Not that I'm calling anyone who would turn his or her spouse in to police A "Snitch" or a rat, but If my wife where to kill someone,' I wouldnt hesitate to flex the 5th amendment! Murder Is a heavy offense But Remember, when you say "I DO", you're basically inviting the person You're marrying into the Family. So ask yourself... would YOU turn in FAMILY?? column4: No way, Marriage (in my eyes) is supposed to be a Bond/Partnership. Not that I'm calling anyone who would turn his or her spouse in to police A "Snitch" or a rat, but If my wife where to kill someone,' I wouldnt hesitate to flex the 5th amendment! Murder Is a heavy offense But Remember, when you say "I DO", you're basically inviting the person You're marrying into the Family. So ask yourself... would YOU turn in FAMILY?? If so, join the police force. If not, kudos! (I would still divorce the crazy chick though!)

column4: If my spouse committed murder I would not turn him in. I would do the exact opposite I will help him hide all evidence if any, I will move if we had to, and I will never bring it up to his attention again. If my husband killed someone, he knew what he was doing, so there or it was for a cost. It would be hard for me to turn in the one I love.
column5: If my husband where to commit a murder I would most likely not turn him in. He's my husband and I'm going to be there for him for better or for worst. We have to protect each other and be their for each other no matter how bad it is. Even if it makes me his accomplice.

column5: No way, Marriage (in my eyes) is supposed to be a Bond/Partnership. Not that I'm calling anyone who would turn his or her spouse in to police A "Snitch" or a rat, but If my wife where to kill someone,' I wouldnt hesitate to flex the 5th amendment! Murder Is a heavy offense But Remember, when you say "I DO", you're basically inviting the person You're marrying into the Family. So ask yourself... would YOU turn in FAMILY?? If so, join the police force. If not, kudos! (I would still divorce the crazy chick though!)

column4: It really depends on what had happened, she would have to tell me the story and I would have to be able to sympathize with her and understand why she did what she did. If I truly felt that she was remorseful for what she did and I can sympathize with her about why she committed murder than maybe I could forgive her and not turn her in.
column5: If my spouse committed murder I would not turn him in. I would do the exact opposite I will help him hide all evidence if any, I will move if we had to, and I will never bring it up to his attention again. If my husband killed someone, he knew what he was doing, so there or it was for a cost. It would be hard for me to turn in the one I love.
column5: Well I definitely would stick by my vows of marriage through the good times and the bad but I mean some people get married without truly knowing who the person is. Hmmm that is a hard one. column5: No way, Marriage (in my eyes) is supposed to be a Bond/Partnership. Not that I'm calling anyone who would turn his or her spouse in to police A "Snitch" or a rat, but If my wife where to kill someone,' I wouldnt hesitate to flex the 5th amendment! Murder Is a heavy offense But Remember, when you say "I DO", you're basically inviting the person You're marrying into the Family. So ask yourself... would YOU turn in FAMILY?? If so, join the police force. If not, kudos! (I would still divorce the crazy chick though!)

If so, join the police force. If not, kudos! (I would still divorce the crazy chick though!)

column4: If my spouse committed murder I would not turn him in. I would do the exact opposite I will help him hide all evidence if any, I will move if we had to, and I will never bring it up to his attention again. If my husband killed someone, he knew what he was doing, so there or it was for a cost. It would be hard for me to turn in the one I love.

column5: No way, Marriage (in my eyes) is supposed to be a Bond/Partnership. Not that I'm calling anyone who would turn his or her spouse in to police A "Snitch" or a rat, but If my wife where to kill someone,' I wouldnt hesitate to flex the 5th amendment! Murder Is a heavy offense But Remember, when you say "I DO", you're basically inviting the person You're marrying into the Family. So ask yourself... would YOU turn in FAMILY?? If so, join the police force. If not, kudos! (I would still divorce the crazy chick though!)

column5: No way, Marriage (in my eyes) is supposed to be a Bond/Partnership. Not that I'm calling anyone who would turn his or her spouse in to police A "Snitch" or a rat, but If my wife where to kill someone,' I wouldnt hesitate to flex the 5th amendment! Murder Is a heavy offense But Remember, when you say "I DO", you're basically inviting the person You're marrying into the Family. So ask yourself... would YOU turn in FAMILY?? If so, join the police force. If not, kudos! (I would still divorce the crazy chick though!)

column4: No way, Marriage (in my eyes) is supposed to be a Bond/Partnership. Not that I'm calling anyone who would turn his or her spouse in to police A "Snitch" or a rat, but If my wife where to kill someone,' I wouldnt hesitate to flex the 5th amendment! Murder Is a heavy offense But Remember, when you say "I DO", you're basically inviting the person You're marrying into the Family. So ask yourself... would YOU turn in FAMILY?? If so, join the police force. If not, kudos! (I would still divorce the crazy chick though!)

Murder Is a heavy offense But Remember, when you say "I DO", you're basically inviting the person You're marrying into the Family. So ask yourself... would YOU turn in FAMILY?? If so, join the police force. If not, kudos! (I would still divorce the crazy chick though!)

column4: No way, Marriage (in my eyes) is supposed to be a Bond/Partnership. Not that I'm calling anyone who would turn his or her spouse in to police A "Snitch" or a rat, but If my wife where to kill someone,' I wouldnt hesitate to flex the 5th amendment! Murder Is a heavy offense But Remember, when you say "I DO", you're basically inviting the person You're marrying into the Family. So ask yourself... would YOU turn in FAMILY?? If so, join the police force. If not, kudos! (I would still divorce the crazy chick though!)

column4: No way, Marriage (in my eyes) is supposed to be a Bond/Partnership. Not that I'm calling anyone who would turn his or her spouse in to police A "Snitch" or a rat, but If my wife where to kill someone,' I wouldnt hesitate to flex the 5th amendment! Murder Is a heavy offense But Remember, when you say "I DO", you're basically inviting the person You're marrying into the Family. So ask yourself... would YOU turn in FAMILY?? If so, join the police force. If not, kudos! (I would still divorce the crazy chick though!)

If they know its him then its just a matter of time.
column5: No I would not turn in my spouse because when you get married you promise to be there for eachother through good or through worse and I would anything to help her but, don't get me wrong though if my spouse were to get caught I will not go down with her because most likley I would have a family to take care of and would not leave them for anything.

column4: More than likely I would not turn in my spouse, because there is that love that binds us together. But on the flip side, if it was just down right cold blooded murder, yes I would turn them in.
column5: If it was the person you truly love and want to spend the rest of your life with then it's a definitely no. People make mistakes but although it's a major crime to murder someone I would still not turn in the person I love the most. If I plan on staying with that person I love for the rest of my life then I would stick with them and never turn them in. And if that means that I am part of that murder by not saying anything, well then so be it.

column5: No way, Marriage (in my eyes) is supposed to be a Bond/Partnership. Not that I'm calling anyone who would turn his or her spouse in to police A "Snitch" or a rat, but If my wife where to kill someone,' I wouldnt hesitate to flex the 5th amendment! Murder Is a heavy offense But Remember, when you say "I DO", you're basically inviting the person You're marrying into the Family. So ask yourself... would YOU turn in FAMILY?? If so, join the police force. If not, kudos! (I would still divorce the crazy chick though!)
